items.sentence: Whenever I find something I like, it\'s too expensive.
You didn\'t drink all the wine that I bought, did you?
You don\'t have to eat with Tom, but I wish you would.
Your ice cream will melt if you don\'t eat it quickly.
I found this book by chance in a secondhand bookstore.
She advised him to go abroad while he was still young.
That kid was almost run over when the truck backed up.
The summit of the mountain is covered with fresh snow.
You could learn a lot from them if you\'d only listen.
You don\'t know how to speak French very well, do you?
You don\'t need to tell me what to do. I already know.
I didn\'t know that soccer was such a dangerous sport.
I didn\'t win, but at least I got a consolation prize.
I don\'t care what people think about the way I dress.
I wonder whether or not Tom is going to do that today.
I wonder whether or not the plane will arrive on time.
I wonder whether or not there really is a Santa Claus.
I had a crowbar in one hand and a hammer in the other.
I have a part-time job working as a Santa at the mall.
I have to make certain Tom knows where he needs to go.
